info.author: Toni Arnold
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
Python bindings for SFST, the Stuttgart Finite State Transducer Tools.

SFST is a toolbox for the implementation of morphological analysers and
other tools which are based on finite state transducer technology.
The SFST implementation language is flexible, powerful, and easy to learn.
SFST was written by Helmut Schmid and is available under
http://www.ims.uni-stuttgart.de/projekte/gramotron/SOFTWARE/SFST.html

To learn how to use it in python, you might want to look in the
tests/index.html file for doctest examples.
info.name: pysfst
info.summary: Python bindings for SFST, the Stuttgart Finite State Transducer Tools
